title: The Fugitive S02E08 F.A.R.T. 1964 Version Dark Corner DivX
description:
From the Fugitive Audio Restoration Team - F.A.R.T. - comes this excellent quality video with the original soundtrack restored! As you probably know, the DVD's of season two of The Fugitive were released with a completely new, synthesized music score which destroyed much of the show's drama. 

Now, thanks to the Fugitive Audio Restoration Team , you can enjoy the show in top quality as it was originally intended to be experienced.

The Fugitive Season 2 (1964)
S02E08 Dark Corner
First aired: 11/10/1964

Kimble finds refuge from the police in a rural farm house, where he meets Mattie Braydon, a sculptress who suffers from hysterical blindness and lives with her older sister and their uncle. Mattie protects Kimble and while hiring him as a farmhand, she also begins using him as a model for her clay sculptures she keeps in the barn. But Kimble soon finds out that the sweet and innocent Mattie is in fact a possessive and manipulative sociopath who wants Kimble for herself and will do anything, including committing murder, to ensure her dark secrets of her past never get revealed. Tuesday Weld Guest stars.

Cast: David Janssen as Dr. Richard Kimble, Barry Morse as Lt. Philip Gerard, Bill Raisch as Fred Johnson (The One-Armed Man), Diane Brewster (flashbacks) as Helen Kimble, J.D.Cannon as Lloyd Chandler, William Conrad as Narrator (voice)

Guest cast: Tuesday Weld (Mattie Braydon), Crahan Denton (Sam Braydon) , Elizabeth MacRae (Clara Braydon), Paul Carr (Bob Matthews), John McLiam (Sheriff Grover), James Seay (Bus Driver), Rudy Dolan (First Deputy), Dave Armstrong (Second Deputy)

(synopsis by jeans2nd)

Read more about the replacement of the original music of this episode:
http://www.filmmusicsociety.org/news_events/features/2008/081508.html
